snippet: Many computer science professors said they think all college students should learn “computational thinking,” but they disagree on its core components.
abstract: Randall Stross Digital Domain column observes colleges are taking widely different paths to teaching general concepts underlying computer programming language; notes many computer science professors say they think all college students should learn 'computational thinking,' but they disagree on its core components.
lead_paragraph: Many computer science professors said they think all college students should learn “computational thinking,” but they disagree on its core components.

headline.seo: Computer Science for Non-Majors Takes Many Forms
headline.main: Computer Science for the Rest of Us
headline.print_headline: Computer Science For the Rest of Us
